subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|いくさ|yomi=kun}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|-|sort=いくさ}}, first attested in the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'' (712 CE) with the original sense of "[[soldier]]".

Considered to derive from a compound, possibly either {{m|ja|的|tr=''ancient ''ikupa'', modern rendering ''ikuha||[[target]]}} + {{m|ja|矢|tr=sa||[[arrow]]}}, or {{m|ja|いくう|いくふ|tr=''ancient ''ikupu'', modern rendering ''ikuu|to [[shoot]] (an arrow)}} + {{m|ja|矢|tr=sa||[[arrow]]}}.  Notably, the ''iku'' in both proposed [[etyma]] appear to be cognate.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The "[[archery]]" sense came later in the ''{{w|Nihon Shoki}}'' (720 CE), then was extended to mean "an [[exchange]] of [[arrow]]s" → "a [[battle]]".

subSections.text: * {{ja-r|戦 を 見て 矢 を 矧ぐ|いくさ を みて や を はぐ||pos=literally "watch a battle, fletch an arrow"}}
